intro: Pterocymbium campanulatum, commonly known as the bell-shaped pterocymbium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. The leaves are elongated and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
